page.title: 09LORD and LADY BADEN-POWELL
page.content:
In 1919 the Baden-Powells came to live in Bentley.{He, as the founder of the {Scouting movement, was Chief Scout and {better known as B.P., while she was {the Chief Guide.}Buying a house named "Blackacre" they greatly enlarged it and renamed it{"Pax Hill"}where they lived for some 20 years. It was later used as a Domestic Training College of Guides for 10 years until finally sold. It has seen used as a private school and is now a nursing home for the more active retired.
The Powells took an active part in the life of the village, he lead the project to build the{Memorial Hall}and founded the Fishing Club. He also designed the present{Village Sign,}for a national competition. It was built by local scouts and exhibited at the Wembley Jamboree in 1924.
